Please read the following terms carefully

This software is completely free and open source! If you paid for it, please request a refund immediately and report the seller. Any resale or redistribution of this software is illegal, and the developer reserves the right to pursue legal action.

1. Software Nature: This launcher is a third-party open-source tool that requires users to provide legally authorized game files.

2. Copyright Notice: You must own a legally authorized copy of the game you are running. The developer is not affiliated with game copyright holders.

3. Usage Restrictions: For personal learning and research purposes only, not for commercial purposes or reverse engineering.

4. Disclaimer: Software is provided as-is, developer is not responsible for any losses caused by use.

5. Privacy Protection: No personal information is collected, all data is stored locally only.

6. Permission Notice: Storage permission is required to access game files, only game-related files are accessed.

7. Legal Liability: Users are responsible for their own illegal use.

8. Terms Changes: Developer reserves the right to modify this notice at any time.
Clicking [Accept and Continue] means you agree to the above terms
The launcher needs storage permission to read and manage game files
Click the button in the bottom right to create a new layout
Click a game on the left to start
Please enter the 4-digit code sent to your email
Cannot connect to GOG server - DNS resolution failed. Please check your network connection or try using VPN
Connection to GOG server timed out. Please check your network connection
Login failed - Please check username and password
Login failed - Incorrect username or password
Two-factor authentication page redirected, session may have expired
Game file path cannot be empty

These components are required to run games. The first installation requires extracting files to the app directory, and the installation process may take 10-30 seconds, depending on device performance.
Select game file and ModLoader (optional) to import
Please grant storage permission to browse files
Accept Legal Notice and Continue Button
Please select a file or folder first
Are you sure you want to delete %s?
Patch import failed, check logs for more information

Patches have the ability to load executable files.
Installing patches with malicious code may result in:
- Personal data and privacy information leakage
- Device damage
Before installation, please confirm that:
- You trust the source of this patch
- You understand the patch's specific functionality
- You have backed up important data
Continuing with installation indicates that you understand and accept the associated risks.

Share network name and secret with friends so they can join the same network
Enter network name and secret, then tap \"Join Network\" to start
Powered by EasyTier P2P. NAT traversal, no public IP required.
Host and guest configurations parsed successfully
Network information is empty or too short
EasyTier port forwarding is active, 127.0.0.1:7777 is reachable

EasyTier port forwarding may not be active.
Possible causes:
1. no_tun mode does not support port forwarding
2. Invalid configuration format
3. EasyTier internal error
After the host starts the server, other players connect to %1$s:port in game
In game, open Multiplayer -> Join via IP and enter %1$s:port
Tap \"Auto Fix\" to try fixing the issues above.
%1$s file may be corrupted: %2$s (%3$d bytes < %4$d bytes)
Please restart the app to complete component reinstallation.
Enter 1,2,3,4 to select a world, n to create a new world, d+number to delete a world
Enter server port (default 7777, press Enter to keep default)
Enter max players (press Enter to keep default)
Enter server password (leave empty for no password, press Enter to skip)
Server started. In game: Multiplayer ‚Üí Join via IP ‚Üí 127.0.0.1:%1$s
Trying UPnP port forwarding, remote players can connect via your public IP
Generating a new world, this may take a few minutes...
Multiplayer uses EasyTier (LGPL-3.0), a third-party open-source component. Please report issues through the relevant channels.
Multiplayer uses P2P technology. After connecting, players connect directly. No third-party relay servers are used for your traffic.
During multiplayer sessions, you must comply with all laws and regulations in your country or region.
Create and sign in to your account on GOG.com
Search and purchase your game (for example Terraria, Stardew Valley)
If you already own the game, skip this step
Click your avatar on GOG.com and open My Games
Find your game and open its download page
Download the SMAPI Linux installer package
Tap Game File on the right and choose the downloaded .sh or .zip file
If needed, tap ModLoader and select the corresponding file
Confirm the detection result above is correct
Tap Start Import and wait for installation to finish
Return to game list to launch the game
